title: Gallery Talk: The Art of Noise
hero_caption: <p>&nbsp;Vasily Kandinsky. <em>Painting with Troika</em>, January 18, 1911. Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection.&nbsp;</p>
description:
Twentieth-century artists have been inspired by and collaborated with musicians to challenge ideas of beauty and perfection. Join Woman’s Board Fellow Alice Boone to discuss these collaborations, where we may even listen to selections from some works to deepen our understanding of the art of noise.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
